As Mohamed suggested a simple bit would suffice. To solve the problem you said about not logging out, add a timeout value to the session. If the user logs in, set isLogged to True and set a timestamp. When that user keeps using the website, update the timestamp with the current time. The timestamp is the measure of user interactivity with the system.
If another user with same name within the defined timeout (say 5 second: CurrentTime - Timestamp <= 5) tries to log in, discard him. Otherwise, accept him if his credentials are correct.
The final solution would be: add a session table, with user_id, isLoggedIn, lastActivity_Timestamp, any information for that session like location etc... 
Note 1: make sure that the timestamp uses one clock (say UTC) for synchronization issues...
Note 2: I assume either you use ACID database like mysql, or CP datastore like zookeeper. If you use AP datastores, this solution may incur inconsistency issues (two users may be logged in to the same account at the same time).
Note 3: I assume that you want the first logged in session to be the primary one, so that the second user will not override the first logged in session.
